epoxy Style Transformers

Source: R/transformers.R
epoxy_style.Rd

These transformers provide additional automatic formatting for the template strings. They are designed to be used with the .transformer chunk option of in epoxy chunks.

Usage

epoxy_style_wrap(before = "**", after = "**")

epoxy_style_bold()

epoxy_style_italic()

epoxy_style_code()

epoxy_style_collapse(
  sep = ", ",
  last = "",
  last_and = " and ",
  last_or = " or ",
  sep_and = sep,
  sep_or = sep
)

Arguments

before, after

In epoxy_style_wrap(), the characters to be added before and after variables in the template string.

sep, sep_and, sep_or

The separator to use when joining the vector elements when the variable ends in *, &, or | respectively. By default, these are all ", ".

last, last_and, last_or

Additional text added after sep before the last element when the variable ends in *, &, or | respectively.

Functions

  • epoxy_style_wrap: Wrap variables

  • epoxy_style_bold: Embolden variables using markdown ** syntax

  • epoxy_style_italic: Italicize variables using markdown _ syntax

  • epoxy_style_code: Code format variables using markdown backtick syntax

  • epoxy_style_collapse: Collapse vector variables.
